item.title: Rujukan Awam Git dan Github
item.description: Global setting Buat git repo dan R pakej Kopi branch di github ke lokal Kopi branch tertentu cara lain Log commit Tidak dapat kesan email Buat kekunci SSH dan daftarkan di Github Pelbagai akaun Permission denied ssh-agent refused operation Buat Repo melalui terminal Padam branch Git Aliases Undo atau Revert Sekiranya ada konflik Release atau tag Buat gh-page git config Global setting Tetapkan email dan nama di global.

item.title: Doom tips
item.description: First published date: 2021-04-27 Some tips to learn the keybindings in Doom and Evil in the process of migrating from my vanilla Emacs settings. For overview of keybindings type SPC-h-b-b. Other good references: Narra’s Blog - Doom Tips and Howtos Org Mode Shortcuts for Emacs Doom Gist of Hjertnes Evil-mode collection Nice Doom Emacs Cheatsheet from niyumard.

item.title: Mount drive
item.description: Install Mount manually Credential Auto mount Other option to mount Execute Access to folders First published date: 2021-02-22 This is only relevant to my personal reference at work. The address for drive F and N is as follow:

item.title: Good to know
item.description: Things that I find it useful during my work: Debuging warnings Sometimes it’s nice to know where in the code that generate warnings especially when it’s related to NA introduced by coercion. To do this we can change the options to make warning as error.

item.title: YesNo question
item.description: Different ways to make your R session interactive for asking question and receive the answer as an input. readline You can find some example in StackOverflow or Geeksforgeeks. Basically is just like this: cp <- as.integer(readline(prompt = "Vil du kopiere filen?

item.title: Cross-reference
item.description: Reference to this is here. Section link The easierst is to use CUSTOM_ID as the example below and refer to it with text [[#sec:one][Section 1]] or reference with number only [[#sec:one]]. * Section One :PROPERTIES: :CUSTOM_ID: sec:one :END: The link with text will be '.

item.title: Smerge, ediff and diff
item.description: First published: 2021-04-30 For enditing conflict in git, use smerge or ediff. Smerge Basic workflow: Open magit status with SPC g g in Doom Identify the mark with Unmerged under Unstage list Go to the file and press Enter to open the file The base command for Smerge is C-c ^ You will see the conflict and selecting the upper with C-c ^ u and lower with C-c ^ l To select all ‘conflicting’ changes press C-c ^ a To navigate the conflicts use C-c ^ n and C-c ^ p for next and previous conflict To see all the keybindings use C-c ^ h With DOOM and hydra:

item.title: Environment
item.description: Several nice blogs and references on the net to read on this stuff. Among those: Environments in R How R Searches and Finds Stuff This discussion from StackOverflow explains nicely with example on the difference between parent.env() and parent.

item.title: Ellipsis ‚Ä¶
item.description: First published: 2020-12-12 Just to remind me how I could use ellipsis or the three dots ... in my coding. There are three scenarios I find it useful: Function wrapper When creating a function wrapper and instead of providing all the arguments to be send further, you could just use .

item.title: MS Access Shutdown
item.description: How to shutdown all running Access when you need to do some changes. This is just a summary from Microsoft Docs. The steps are: Create empty text file This file will be the key. Name the file to anything like checkfile.
